name: Henry Yuen
content: Henry Yuen's homepage Henry Yuen Associate Professor of Computer Science Columbia University papers talks teaching service blog I am the Srivani Family Associate Professor of Computer Science at Columbia University. I am a member of the CS Theory group, the Data Science Institute, and the Columbia Quantum Initiative. My research focuses on the theoretical foundations of quantum computing, with a focus on complexity theory and cryptography. Current Teaching Fall 2025: COMS 4281 Introduction to Quantum Computing Advising Graduate students Zikuan Huang (co-advised with James Bartusek) Leo Orshansky (co-advised with Tal Malkin) Saachi Mutreja Natalie Parham John Bostanci Adrian She (PhD 2024, co-advised with Toni Pitassi) Hamoon Mousavi (PhD 2023 $\rightarrow$ Postdoc @ EPFL) Gregory Rosenthal (PhD 2023, co-advised with Ben Rossman $\rightarrow$ Postdoc @ IQC Waterloo) Arthur Mehta (PhD 2021 $\rightarrow$ Assistant Professor @ U. Ottawa) Postdocs Barak Nehoran (Fall 2025 - ) Uma Girish (Assistant Professor @ U. Toronto in Fall 2026) Cunlu Zhou (Assistant Professor @ U. of Sherbrooke) Misc CV Nonlocal: A Quantum Computing Podcast
